headline.main: Health Efforts Widen on a Fetal Danger

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: WHEN Joanne B. learned that she was pregnant, she was determined to have a healthy baby. She quit smoking. She stopped taking over-the-counter cold medicines. She sought medical advice about drinking and was assured that ''one drink won't hurt.''

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Should you drink coffee? Caffeinated coffee, that is, or other caffeinated drinks, like tea or cola. Increasing numbers of people are cutting down on caffeine, switching to decaffeinated drinks or abandoning caffeine altogether.
